question.title: ArrayList Iterate Front to Back
question.content:
Iterators are used to iterate over Java Collections. Here we will learn to iterate over an ArrayList arr from begin to end.

Examples:

Input: 1 2 3 4 5
Output: 1 2 3 4 5
Explanation: Simply print the elements.

Input: 1 3 31 2 
Output: 1 3 31 2
Explanation: Simply print the elements.

Constraints:
1 <= n <= 107
0 <= arri <= 107

rephrased.body: Iterate through the elements of an ArrayList from the beginning to the end using iterators. The goal is to print each element of the ArrayList in the order they appear.
constraints: 1 <= n <= 10^7, where n is the number of elements in the ArrayList
0 <= arr[i] <= 10^7, where arr[i] is the value of the i-th element in the ArrayList

testcases.explanation: Print the elements in the order they are given.
Print the elements in the order they are given.
